details.title: Trump in India: Big-ticket defence deals worth billions in today's agenda
details.content: Addressing an adoring crowd of over one lakh people at the newly-built Motera cricket stadium in the Gujarat capital, Trump appeared to take everyone off guard when he said, 'I’m pleased to announce that our representatives will sign defence deals worth over USD 3 billion to sell absolute finest state-of-the-art military helicopters and other equipment to the Indian armed forces.' (READ MORE)

details.title: Ahead of trade deals, Donald Trump accorded ceremonial reception at Rashtrapati Bhawan
details.content:
US President Donald Trump was accorded a ceremonial welcome at Rashtrapati Bhavan. Trump's daughter Ivanka, son-in-law Jared Kushner and several top officials of the US administration were also present at the ceremony.

(Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: OPINION | Donald Trump India’s visit is not about trade alone
details.content: The US believes India’s threat perception and policy of diversification of sources of procurement of defence hardware will make it turn towards America as a defence partner. (READ MORE)

details.title: Trump India visit: Day 2 schedule
details.content: On his second day, a ceremonial reception at the Rashtrapati Bhavan will be followed by a meeting between Trump and PM Modi at Hyderabad House after which an exchange of agreements will take place. Meanwhile, First Lady Melania Trump will be visiting a Delhi government school in Nanakpura on Tuesday, where she is expected to attend a 'happiness' class.

details.title: EDITORIAL | Will India join U.S. counter to China’s BRI?
details.content: The Western alternative has been in the making for some time as nations have voiced alarm at the cheque-book diplomacy of China through its BRI projects and their security ramifications. (READ MORE)

details.title: Trumps pay their respects to Mahatma Gandhi at Raj Ghat
details.content: Donald Trump laid a wreath at Rajghat, the samadhi of Mahatma Gandhi and was accompanied by the First Lady.

details.title: Donald Trump inspects the Guard of Honour at Rashtrapati Bhavan
details.content: (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: ITC Maurya ready to WOW Trump with its special Presidential platter
details.content: It is largely expected that POTUS 45 will follow the tradition set by his predecessors and sample a specially curated Presidential Platter, served at the hotel’s iconic restaurant Bukhara, which specialises in cuisine from the north-west frontier, with a focus on tandoori items. (READ MORE)

details.title: POTUS, FLOTUS given warm welcome at Rashtrapati Bhawan by President Kovind
details.content: (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: US President Donald Trump's message in visitor's book at Raj Ghat
details.content: 'The American people stand strongly with a sovereign and wonderful India - The vision of the great Mahatma Gandhi. This is a tremendous honor,' signed Trump. (Photo | ANI)

details.title: Donald Trump, Melania reach Hyderabad House for talk with Modi
details.content:
US President met Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House for bilateral talks.

Delhi: US President Donald Trump meets PM Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House, First Lady Melania Trump also present. pic.twitter.com/rz9yYLc1Rb

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: With US President Trump by his side, PM Modi vows to fight terror
details.content: Describing Namaste Trump event as new history, Modi said that Trump’s visit will mark a chapter that will be a document of progress and prosperity of the Indian and American people. (READ MORE)

details.title: Meanwhile, FLOTUS to visit Delhi schools for 'happiness class'
details.content: US First Lady Melania Trump will take a tour of Delhi government schools, go to different classes, interact with the students and witness different activities being conducted as part of the 'happiness curriculum.'

details.title: Modi-Trump to hold bilateral talks, sign trade deals
details.content:
The deals mentioned by Donald Trump will include:

  • Procurement of 24 MH-60 Romeo helicopters by India from the US at a cost of USD 2.6 billion.
  • Contract to acquire six AH-64E Apache helicopters for USD 800 million from the US is also on the table.


The US President is also expected to discuss religious freedoms and the contentious Citizenship Act with Prime Minister Modi.

details.title: Delhi school students greet First Lady Melania ahead of 'happiness curriculam'
details.content:
Delhi: First Lady of the US, Melania Trump arrives at Sarvodaya Co-Ed Senior Secondary School. She is visiting the school as part of her visit to the city today. pic.twitter.com/EnuVWjO7KB

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: Hope you have a great time: Sisodia greets First Lady Melania
details.content:
Welcome to our school @FLOTUS! We hope you would have a great time here in #HappinessClass

It's just 18 months old initiative but early results have made us confident that @HappinessDelhi is the ultimate solution to all violence & hate in mindsets that we r facing worldwide.

— Manish Sisodia (@msisodia) February 25, 2020

details.title: Hope you have a great time: Sisodia greets First Lady Melania
details.content:
Welcome to our school @FLOTUS! We hope you would have a great time here in #HappinessClass

It's just 18 months old initiative but early results have made us confident that @HappinessDelhi is the ultimate solution to all violence & hate in mindsets that we r facing worldwide.

— Manish Sisodia (@msisodia) February 25, 2020

details.title: 'Tilak' welcome for First Lady before 'happiness class'
details.content: Melania Trump visits Delhi government school, welcomed with tilak. (Photo | ANI)

details.title: PM Modi, President Trump hold talks at Hyderabad House
details.content:
Key things expected:

  • USD 3 billion defence deals to be signed
  • Major Indo-US energy deal likely
  • Talks to expand global partnership

details.title: JUST IN | Donald Trump to hold unscheduled press conference at 5 pm: Agencies
details.content: (Photo | AP)

details.title: Trump thanks people for an 'amazing experience' in India
details.content:
While giving a joint statement with PM Narendra Modi in Hyderabad House, Donald Trump thanked for an amazing experience at Motera Stadium in Ahmedabad. In his opening remarks, US President said that the 'Namaste Trump' event a great honour and that the crowd cheered everytime he mentioned something about Modi.

(Photo | PIB Twitter)

details.title: Cops man every 100 metres in Lutyens Delhi amid Trump's visit
details.content: Roads and lanes leading to President House have been temporary closed with traffic on stand still for almost an hour as the US President and the First Lady Melania Trump were accorded a ceremonial welcome earlier in the day. (READ MORE)

details.title: Melania Trump says she is inspired by 'Happiness Curriculum'
details.content:
'In the US, I work with children like you to promote similar ideas of well-being through my 'BE BEST' initiative.Three pillars of 'BE BEST' include dangers of drug abuse, importance of online safety&overall well-being of children.' said the First Lady while she addressed 'happiness class.'

(Photo|AP)

details.title: Be it defence, security or energy, all aspects were discussed: PM Modi
details.content: PM Modi began the joint press conference in New Delhi saying that important aspects of US-India partnership were discussed with Donald Trump. He further added that strengthening defence ties between India and US is an important aspect of India-US partnership.

details.title: India to purchase more than USD 3 billion in advanced US military equipment: Trump
details.content:
US President: Earlier today we expanded our defence cooperation with agreements for India to purchase more than US$ 3 Bn of advanced American military equipment, including Apache & MH-60 Romeo Helicopters - finest in the world. These will enhance our joint defence capabilities. pic.twitter.com/TD6xMTx20q

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: Key highlights from Modi-Trump joint press briefing
details.content:
• Defence deals worth around USD 3 billion have been inked
  • Deal for procurement of 24 MH-60 Romeo helicopters by India
  • Contract to acquire six AH-64E Apache helicopters
  • Talks on India-US working together to eradicate terror
  • Talks for a free and balanced Indo-Pacific region discussed
  • Importance of a secure 5G wireless network and technology discussed
  • Aim for comprehensive global strategic partnership discussed by Trump

details.title: Trump's visit throws Delhi's traffic out of gear
details.content:
From forenoon till around 4 p.m. on February 25, traffic is likely to remain heavy in the areas of Moti Bagh, Chanakyapuri, India Gate, areas around ITO, Delhi Gate and adjoining areas of Central and New Delhi. Necessary traffic diversions as per the ground situation may also be enforced, the Delhi traffic police said. 

Due to US First Lady Melania Trump's visit to the Sarvodaya School in South Moti Bagh area, traffic restrictions were clamped on Mahatma Gandhi Road as well.

details.title: Trump meets India Inc at US Embassy in Delhi
Coronavirus is getting under control
details.content: 'China is working very hard, I have spoken to President Xi. It looks like China is getting it under control,' says Donald Trump.

details.title: India, US sign pacts in health, oil sectors
details.content: India and US have signed three agreements in health and oil sectors. A memorandum of understanding (MoU) was signed on mental health too, says Trump

details.title: Markets will crash if I lose 2020 US election, says Donald Trump at India Inc roundtable
details.content: CLICK HERE TO READ MORE

details.title: Modi said he wants people to have religious freedom: Trump on CAA
details.content: We did talk about religious freedom. The PM said he wants people to have religious freedom. They have worked really hard on it. I heard about the individual attacks but I did not discuss it. It is up to India.

details.title: Trump offers to mediate on Kashmir yet again
details.content: Donald Trump during his presser in Delhi yet again offered to mediate on Kashmir, said 'anything I can do'. Kashmir has been a thorn in lots of people's sight for a long time. There are two sides to every story. We discussed terrorism at length today.

details.title: Delhi unrest India's matter: Trump
details.content: Heard about Delhi violence but didn't discuss it with Modi. Unrest is India's internal matter, says Donald Trump.

details.title: Trump to tuck into a Tandoori menu?
details.content: So, how will the US President end his visit? It is largely expected that POTUS 45 will follow the tradition set by his predecessors and sample a specially curated Presidential Platter, served at the hotel's iconic restaurant Bukhara, which specialises in cuisine from the north-west frontier, with a focus on tandoori items.

details.title: WATCH | Ram Nath Kovind receives the US first couple as they arrive for a dinner banquet at the Rashtrapati Bhawan
details.content:
#WATCH Delhi: US President Donald Trump & First Lady Melania Trump received at Rashtrapati Bhawan by President Ram Nath Kovind and his wife Savita Kovind. A dinner banquet will be hosted by President in honour of the US President. pic.twitter.com/nUXYUR2D7R

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020
US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump meet PM Narendra Modi, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and other Union Ministers, at Rashtrapati Bhawan.

details.title: Curious about what dishes will the US first couple will be savouring tonight? Here's the menu!
details.content:
Delhi: Menu of the dinner banquet at Rashtrapati Bhavan hosted in the honour of US President Donald Trump. pic.twitter.com/qcnwzWkJDz

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: Trumps meet Chief Ministers of Haryana, Assam, Telangana and Karnataka at the Rashtrapati Bhawan
details.content:
Delhi: US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump meet Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa, Telangana CM K. Chandrashekar Rao, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar, at the Rashtrapati Bhawan. pic.twitter.com/Q0tlvSe9vr

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: Donald Trump hugs PM Modi as they leave after attending their dinner banquet
details.content:
Delhi: US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump leave after attending dinner banquet hosted by the President Ram Nath Kovind at Rashtrapati Bhawan. PM Narendra Modi also present. pic.twitter.com/dTlBYDtRzz

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020

details.title: PM Modi thanks Donald Trump for visiting India, calls visit 'path-breaking'
details.content:
Thank you @POTUS @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS @MELANIATRUMP for coming to India. This visit has been a path-breaking one. We have covered great ground as far as strengthening bilateral relations are concerned. India-USA friendship benefits the people of our nations and the world.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) February 25, 2020

details.title: And it's a wrap! Trumps board their jet to head back to US as their two-day visit to India concludes
details.content:
US President Donald Trump & First Lady Melania Trump depart from Delhi following the conclusion of their two-day visit to India. pic.twitter.com/llalDcR5W9

— ANI (@ANI) February 25, 2020
